content.description: Climb the finger crack system just right of Bemis.    Zippers up well with small cams and nuts.  Orginially rated 5.8.  The grade, however, is form the old days and the climb is probably closer to 5.9+ by modern standards.
content.location: Right of Bemis and left of Ghost.

content.description: Climb under a roof to the obvious, straight, hand crack.  Originally rated 5.9+ it is probably harder by today's standards.  Although relatively short, there are no options for rest, so the climb is strenuous.  However, it zippers up very well.
content.location: Right of Winter is Coming and left of the bulky, quartz corner.

content.description: Good warm up for the climbs to the left. protect wisely off the ground to reach the first bolt, air it out on jugs above the bolt then continue up the corner/crack system to a two bolt anchor.Climbing this pitch is a good way to take a look into the guts of contorsionism on the lower off. Maybe even pre hang the draws, if your into that kinda 'buffoonery". Go easy on the rope when lowering.

Climb the clean looking arete past 7 bolts.  A hold on the top-out recently broke and significantly increases the difficulty of the last move.  The end can be bypassed by moving far right to the finish of Winter is Coming.
content.protection: Quick draws; gear to rap off tree at the top.
content.location: Far left arete that begins the Bemis Area.

content.description: This wall is the furthest left wall of the Main Wall.  It is about 40 feet tall framed by the Bemis Arete on the left and a bluky, quartz face on the right.  The base is a comfortable, flat, plateau above the a ledge/boulders.  Two, distinct cracks run vertical up the face, between the two ends.
